remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling system is operated with one fan deactivated,
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operative.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operating for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN and EE CLNG INBD EXH may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.
Carriage of animals and perishables in associated lower forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "SUPPLY VLV/INBD EXH FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: TO DEACTIVATE THE INBOARD SUPPLY VALVE CLOSED, USE EITHER PROCEDURE A (DEACTIVATE EXHAUST FAN) OR PROCEDURE B (DEACTIVATE SUPPLY FAN)

numlitem.para: Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from Inboard Supply Valve, located behind the forward cargo lining at STA 580.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P415 panel EQPT COOLING EXHAUST FAN circuit breaker.

note.para: EE Cooling System will not provide adequate equipment cooling until the Inboard Supply Valve is closed. EICAS caution message EQUIP COOLING will be displayed and ground crew call horn will sound if the following step is not accomplished within 30 seconds after opening the circuit breaker in step 4 above.

numlitem.para: Determine inboard Supply Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position.

note.para: Status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.

numlitem.para: Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.

note.para: This open circuit breaker removes power from the Inboard Supply, Inboard Exhaust and Bypass Valves. Closed loop mode operation is not available until circuit breaker is again closed.

numlitem.para: Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from inboard Supply Valve located behind the forward cargo lining at STA 580.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P414 panel EQPT COOLING SUPPLY FAN circuit breaker.

note.para: EE Cooling System will not provide adequate equipment cooling until the Inboard Supply Valve is closed. EICAS caution message EQUIP COOLING will be displayed and the ground crew call horn will sound if the following step is not accomplished within 30 seconds after opening the circuit breaker in step 4 above.

numlitem.para: Determine Inboard Supply Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position.

note.para: Status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
Temperature gradients are to be expected during these inoperative conditions. Predicted cargo compartment temperatures (which may vary) when forward cargo heat is inoperative:

entry.para: Ground Operation – Steady State Temperatures with A/C Packs ON
